text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that US courts apply the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine only in domestic arbitration and not in foreign award enforcement under the New York Convention. The candidate answer discusses numerous arguments for defending enforcement under Article V, focusing on narrow construction, competence-competence, separability, and due process, but it entirely fails to mention or address the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine, which is a key distinction between domestic (FAA) and foreign (Convention) enforcement standards in the US.", "criterion_id": "0b829d90-0ded-4a7c-9508-72d4252c8baa"}
